column5: Hello ya'll Headed to Pipestone Lake in a week for one week trip. Rarely see any reports on here about that lake. There are a few but they seem older. It will be our first time to this lake. It's been difficult to find much info online as there are very few reports and minimal lake maps. We have some info from the lodge of course, but I just want to cover all my bases. Any recent reports that anyone knows of? Any special tactics I should prepare for on this lake? Any general info you feel to share? You can PM me or post here. Any help is greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance, KC

We fished that lake several years ago. Stayed at Happy Landing before it burned down. Probably fished there 12 trips. Also stayed at Pipestone Lodge one year. When the lake is "on" its great fishing. We fished mostly walleye. Very deep lake in places. Very clear water. Nice lake. Good Luck.

Exceptionally clear water...stay well back from target and cast from a distance if you can.I hit the heart of the mayfly hatch and a week of hot weather with cloudless skies and no wind...still did OK.
Thanks for some info. Anyone else fished it recently? Thanks in advance

I put up a map of Pipestone Lake. The quality is quite poor, but it's readable for the most part. I also included the unprocessed original.Scroll down to Other Lakes on the linked page.http://www.lineonfishing.com/index.p...ake-depth-maps
Cool. Thank you. That's about my luck with info on this lake. Lol. Thanks again guys. Will post report in a week or so.

Recent trip was a bust.....very tough walleye fishing to say the least. 5 very experienced walleye fishermen caught 30 or so walleyes in a week and none over 25". Not complaining I guess as it beats working, but still frustrating with all the effort that was put in. Other people in camp caught basically 0 walleyes each day so I guess we did better than most. I won't post much more as I don't want to dissuade anyone from trying this lake. But be forewarned, fishing for walleyes on Pipestone is very tough.....VERY! Haha. Happy Fishing y'all, KC
